column4: I have a printer installed on my desktop, It's shared. How do I use the printer from my laptop (both lappie and desktop are connnected through a router)
: is your desktop an ubuntu machine ?
both machines are
this looked good : http://occy.net/printing
my printer is not a networking printer. But shouldn't I be able to acces it somehow? My desktop is always running btw, it's configured as a web server
Ah, I think one issue I might have is that I don't have a LAN set up :(
That should be pretty staightforward in Linux, yes?
if your computers are connected to a router - that is a LAN
- computer one could be 192.168.1.100 computer two 192.168.1.101   etc etc
Ok, forgive me. last time I networked computers was in wondows , where one had to set up the windows networking stuff, etc
i haven't done printer sharing in linux - but i assume there are good guides out there
Thanks for your help
are you still around?
kinda
thankyouthankyouthankyou
its working?
got it working. Forgot to restart cups, but when I did it's perfect
congrats - glad i could help
thanks!
- remove the cdrom from your sources list
- i mean repository sources list
I understood ya :)
yes, I installed from the DVD because the net install wasn't working for me when I upgraded from 6.02 or whatever
